member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.ArtifactType
member.summary: These are the artifacts surfaced by Hatteras.

members.member: URL components to support BIS linking external addressability

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.ClientArtifact
member.summary: Each post-checkin event contains a set of artifacts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.ClientArtifact.Url
member.summary: The Url representing the artifact.
member.remarks: Each Url should be in BIS Uri format (if provided by another tool); Hatteras uses BIS Urls for changesets, labels, files/folders (tip and versioned).

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckinWorkItemCheckinAction
member.summary: Capture the user's intent on work items accompanying the checkin.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckinWorkItemInfo.Title
member.summary: The value of this field becomes the email subject.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NameValuePair.Name
member.summary: This is the name of the field this value is bound too.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NameValuePair.Value
member.summary: The value is a string that is recorded for this field when the release note is saved.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.ShelvesetEvent
member.summary: The client shelveset event for email notifications

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.ShelvesetEvent.Clone
member.summary: Perform a deep copy of a ShelvesetEvent object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.ShelvesetEvent.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the shelveset

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.ShelvesetEvent.EventType
member.summary: The type of shelveset event

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.ShelvesetEvent.GetEventTypeString
member.summary: Gets the EventType string for formatting in Title and ContentTitle

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.ShelvesetEvent.Title
member.summary: Return the title of the shelveset event.
member.remarks: By convention, this also becomes the 'Subject' in alert email

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.ShelvesetEvent.ContentTitle
member.summary: The content title.
member.remarks:
This content title differs slightly from the title. The content title does not include the team projects.
The content title is listed as the "title" in the email alert.
member.value: The value of the content title

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckinEvent
member.summary:
A checkin event encompasses information about the check-in addition to other items, e.g., work items that are related to the check-in.
All check-ins include a changeset, date/time information, owner/committer and a (possibly empty) comment.
member.remarks: Note that a CheckinEvent object is the basis upon which post-checkin alerts are formed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckinEvent.#ctor(System.Int32,System.DateTime,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Construct an object using check-in values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckinEvent.#ctor(System.Int32,System.DateTime,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Construct an object using check-in values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckinEvent.#ctor(System.Int32,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Construct an object using a changeset number and the date/time the changeset was created.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckinEvent.Clone
member.summary: Perform a deep copy of a CheckinEvent object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckinEvent.Title
member.summary: Return the title of the checkin event.
member.remarks: By convention, this also becomes the 'Subject' in alert email

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckinEvent.ContentTitle
member.summary: The content title.
member.remarks:
This content title differs slightly from the title. The content title does not include the team projects.
The content title is listed as the "title" in the email alert.
member.value: The value of the content title

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckinEvent.PolicyFailures
member.summary: Policy failure information for the checkin.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckinEvent.Committer
member.summary: Return the committer associated with the checkin event. The committer is the identity that submitted the checkin.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckinEvent.CommitterDisplay
member.summary: Return the committer associated with the checkin event's display name. The committer is the identity that submitted the checkin.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckinEvent.Number
member.summary: Returns the changeset identifier.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NotificationEvent
member.summary: Abstract class for notification events

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NotificationEvent.#ctor(System.DateTime,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Construct an object using check-in values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NotificationEvent.#ctor(System.DateTime,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Construct an object using check-in values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NotificationEvent.Owner
member.summary: Return the owner associated with the checkin event. The owner may be different from the committer when a proxy identity performs the checkin. In this case, the owner is the identity for whom the proxy identity performs the checkin.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NotificationEvent.OwnerDisplay
member.summary: Return the owner associated with the checkin event's display name. The owner may be different from the committer when a proxy identity performs the checkin. In this case, the owner is the identity for whom the proxy identity performs the checkin.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NotificationEvent.AllChangesIncluded
member.summary: Indicates whether the included changes have been limited due to resource controls.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NotificationEvent.TimeZone
member.summary: Returns the name of the caller's local time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NotificationEvent.TimeZoneOffset
member.summary: Returns the offset, from GMT, of the caller's local time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NotificationEvent.Notice
member.summary: For display puproses and may be null. Contains important information that relates to the checkin display process.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NotificationEvent.Subscriber
member.summary: When used in the alert process, contains the name of the user who subscribed to the alert. This information can be used by the alert recipient when necessary.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NotificationEvent.TeamProjectListSeparator
member.summary: Separator used to separate various TeamProject names in the TeamProject property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NotificationEvent.TeamProject
member.summary: The team project(s) represented in this event
member.remarks: There may be multiple team projects. Multiple team projects are represented using a resource-defined separator.
member.value: A string containing the team project(s) represented in this event

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NotificationEvent.CheckinNotes
member.summary: (Optional) Checkin notes for the checkin.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NotificationEvent.PolicyOverrideComment
member.summary: Policy override information for the checkin.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NotificationEvent.CheckinInformation
member.summary: Additional information conveyed at checkin time

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NotificationEvent.Artifacts
member.summary: A set of related artifacts.
member.remarks: Related artifacts are those artifacts that are germane to a just-completed "check-in" activity and can include: changeset, work-item, file(s), release notes and possibly other artifacts from extensions.
member.value: Each artifact consists of a BIS Url if the "artifact type" is one exposed via the BIS linking service. Checkin Note Urls, e.g., are *not* exposed via the BIS linking service (in this case, a Hatteras Url represents the release notes).

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.NotificationEvent.CommentText(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a comment string that is less than or equal to maxCommentChars
member.remarks:
The returned string is usually part of the email 'Subject' and content titles.
The returned string is processed as follows: 1. Leading and trailing white space is removed 2. If the first newline occurs prior to the max, the string up to (but not including the newline) is returned. 3. If the length of the (trimmed) comment is less than the max, it is returned 4. A substring of the first max characters with '...' suffixed is returned.
member.param: The comment text
The maximum number of comment characters
member.returns: A string that represents the comment trimmed accordingly

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlIntegrationUri
member.summary:
Manipulate BIS Uris. BIS Uris are the unit with which the BIS Linking service works. Bis Uris are of the format: vstfs:///scc/artifactType/artifactID
The BIS linking service transforms the URL and resolves toolType to a specific Hatteras server instance.
BIS Uri examples: Changeset: vstfs:///scc/changeset/30939 File: vstfs:///scc/versionedItem/HatServer/Security.cs?changesetVersion=3&deletionId=7 Label: vstfs:///scc/label/Build.040218 Latest Version Items: vstfs:///scc/latestItemVersion/339
Corresponding URLs Hatteras will respond to (Hatteras is the "application") Changeset: http://hatServer/Hatteras/changeset.aspx?artifactMoniker=30939 File: http://hatServer/Hatteras/versionedItem.aspx?artifactMoniker=HatServer/Security.cs&changesetVersion=3&deletionId=7 Label: http://hatServer/Hatteras/label.aspx?artifactMoniker=Build.040218 Latest Version Items: http://Hatteras/latestItemVersion.aspx?artifactMoniker=339

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.InvalidUriException

members.member: Returns a localized string given a resource string name.
Returns a localized integer given a resource string name.
Returns a localized string given a resource string name.

A little helper function to alleviate some typing associated with loading resources and formatting the strings. In DEBUG builds, it also asserts that the number of format arguments and the length of args match.
